title: Riot can you please address the FPS issues after 4.21?
body: After diagnosing the issue and concluding it was something in patch 4.21 that caused FPS issues in game, it would be greatly appreciated if you could address the issue and solve the problem. As a large company, customer service should be a priority and seeing many people with the same issue and not getting a response is not only disappointing, but shameful.

replies.body: The only way to get their attention is for a massive amount of people to start complaining about it on here. I am having the same issues. Luckily I have a decent computer and I can still play but my FPS has gone from 160 down to 80-90 which is a significant decrease. And sometimes I get random lag spikes that cause the screen to black out for a millisecond and lag which is really annoying. I have been looking at the R3D logs and there are THOUSANDS of errors. It's not our computers at all that are the problem. They messed up on some coding in that last update. I know for a fact.

Didn't have this problems until 4.21 and now all of a sudden I'm experiencing firewall bug, massive spikes and packet loss during games, and random dcs which I cannot reconnect too. Pretty frustrated just like all these other guys and have tried almost everything from flushing my dns cache to uninstaling a variety of programs.

Hey Lucifer,

Like I mentioned over [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/krOBW20O-fps-still-borderline-unplayable-after-patch?comment=0000) we've been investigating these issues. We've definitely been keeping an eye on this problem and have been trying a few things to get this issue resolved. I still recommend checking out the [FPS Knowledge Base](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-troubleshooting) just to make sure there isn't anything contributing to this on your side. 

After performing these steps, I recommend you try it out in a custom game. If you're still experiencing problems, please attach your most recent r3d logs! You can find them on your computer at this location:

Your Install location (Normally C:) > Riot Games > League of Legends > Logs > Game - R3d Logs

They are named by date. 2014-12-18...r3d.log is what you want to look for.

Do you think there is a way that we could get more involved in this? I  have tried everything you guys have said on the forums, and even submitted a ticket. Seeing that it's been acknowledged that this is an issue and that you guys are working on it, do you think it could be made more public (such as putting it on the server status page or in the client) and maybe getting an ETA?  I understand that you all have lots of work to do and it's greatly appreciated. I just want to see a game that I enjoy actually work for me again.

On the old map just before the swap I had over 500 fps. On the new map just after the swap I had around 450-480 with sometimes low 300s. Now I roughly ~150 FPS with no hardware changes and no drops in performance in other games. This is on a GTX 770 OC and i7-4770k OC @ 4.6GHz and 16 GB RAM @ 3200Mhz and no thermal issues. There are clearly issues specifically due to something Riot screwed up and the mass amount of complaints about FPS performance only further supports this statement. Simply repairing the client doesn't fix the issue. Might want to give a higher priority to the problem considering how severe it is and due to the fact that the new map was supposed to make performance better rather then significantly worse. The fact that a solution has not been found begs the question, why are you guys not keeping proper logs for changes committed to code? Would certainly have helped pinpoint the issue much sooner.

They're just sloppy. I have never heard of so many errors and issues after updates for any other MOBA's. To have such a large fan base, that pores money into the game, yet do such a lousy job of up-keeping the stability of their game. It's pathetic.

Yeah, they are stuck on an ancient code base that they refuse to update despite the fact that such an update is actually minimal due to the type of game were talking about here, same for Adobe Air client. They don't appear to follow any proper coding standards or basic concepts like object-oriented design. I had been planning to upload any bugs I found once I realized Shadowplay would let me catch them without consuming absurd amounts of space unlike Fraps, and such, but after accumulating so many videos of various bugs (and only keeping the ones that were blatantly obvious/indisputable, sniping across map with Syndra's E, projectiles flying through multiple players, ward blocking my path when it should have zero physics, WW ult continuing despite stuns, kill timer bugs still catching kills despite 15+ seconds later, tower aggro bugs, etc.) I quickly became overwhelmed despite only playing a handful of games and have been too lazy to upload them due to the amount of videos were dealing with (some 30 in less then 70 games, really?!).
Thank you, I will do that after work today.

COMPAINCOMPLAIN.

By that I'm not mocking y'all, but saying I am having the same problem.

There are indeed tons of errors. Tons. I feel like the entire QA team has been on strike the last two or three updates.

Give in to their demands, please.

I'm curious if any of the people in this thread have had any improvements or found any fixes yet since this post appears to be about a month old and I've been having FPS drops and nonfunctional spectator mode for about the same length of time. I've also already tried all the fps trouble shooting and deleting that one config file thing and reinstalled etc and am  currently a couple days in with no help past those suggestions on a support ticket. I'm anxious to be able to play ranked and have been unable to play a single game all the way through without unplayable lag due to random fps drops for weeks so I don't wanna risk it.  When they first switched the map everything was fine then suddenly this. I seems like I can play the game normally for about 30ish minutes at the start of the day then the fps drops to unplayable lows and stays that way. 

Earlier I thought I'd test and see if it's just my computer and tried to spectate a game on my husband's computer (which is much better than mine) and his also just crashed on attempt. Haven't tried to play a game on it but based on that I figured it's likely not just my computer's problem.
